intro: Bartsia odontites, commonly known as the toothed bartsia, is a small, herbaceous perennial plant native to western Europe. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and semi-parasitic species. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have toothed margins, giving it its common name. Bartsia odontites produces small, pale yellow flowers clustered in terminal racemes, which bloom in late spring to early summer.
